main event: An unidentified object, described as a silver disc the size of a half dollar, was observed in Duncanville, Texas on November 17, 1959.
interesting points: The object was first seen in the East and then disappeared in the Southwest., The total duration of the observation was between 5 to 10 minutes., Witnesses noted that the sighting was similar to that of a weather balloon., The object was circular in shape with a bright glowing body and a dark rim., Witnesses estimated the size of the object to be approximately 50 feet in diameter.
witness description: Witness described observing a bright glowing disc moving rapidly across the sky.
